adverbs.description: diametrically (comparative more diametrically, superlative most diametrically)

entries.meaning: Separated by a diameter, on exactly the opposite side.
(especially in the phrase diametrically opposed) Absolutely (in opposition).
examples: The distinctness of London has led many to clamor for the capital to pursue its own policies, especially on immigration. The British prime minister, David Cameron, is a Conservative. So is the mayor of London, Boris Johnson. But they have diametrically opposed views on immigration.
